basics.name: Mudit Somani
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a passionate technologist with a drive for continuous learning and a curiosity for obscure or emerging technologies. I pride myself on my ability to dive deep into technical challenges and master new tools with focused intensity.

work.name: Cockroach Labs
work.description: Cockroach Labs is the creator of CockroachDB, the cloud native, distributed SQL database 338+ enterprises trust to run mission-critical applications.
work.summary: Merged a production-ready feature into CockroachDB and owned the full development lifecycle, from initial design, testing and implementation to final merge and technical documentation
highlights: Added an OpenTelemetry-compatible log sink for CockroachDB to standardize observability and enhance system interoperability.
Introduced Protocol Buffers as a log serialization option, enabling a 20% reduction in network egress.
Created a OpenTelemetry processor to redact sensitive logs on-the-fly, reducing network throughput by 50%.

work.name: ByteLeap
work.description: ByteLeap is a top-notch Product Engineering studio. Leveraging cutting-edge technologies and a deep understanding of user-centric design to deliver superior product engineering solutions.
work.summary: Interacted with multiple clients in a fast-paced environment to deliver software solutions on time.
highlights: Developed a full-stack LMS system with an admin panel and WYSIWYG editor to help train english teachers using React, NextJS, Prisma, and CockroachDB.
Built the SaaS platform for Athena copilot, a RAG-enabled AI assistant, using Clerk for authentication, NextJS, Sentry, Prisma and ShadCN UI Components.

volunteer.summary: Mentored an international student, providing technical guidance for the development of a terminal UI framework for the Dart programming language.
highlights: Conducted rigorous code reviews for over 35+ pull requests, ensuring adherence to project architecture, security standards, and best practices.
Managed the full project lifecycle, from initial proposal vetting and technical scoping to final delivery and documentation.

volunteer.organization: CRUX - the Coding Club of BITS Pilani, Hyderabad
volunteer.summary: Overseeing operations of the programming and computing club of BITS Pilani, Hyderabad which is responsible for the advocacy of coding culture in the campus.
highlights: Curated and led the development of 3+ open-source projects that were used by over 2000+ students on campus.
Streamlined onboarding process to happen every 2 months instead of once every semester to better capture student interest and reduce onboarding friction.
Organized workshops and mentored students on competitive programming, web development, and open-source contributions.

volunteer.summary: Created applications and tools to improve developer experience for the Dart programming language ecosystem along with stress testing the dart2wasm compiler and FFI capabilities.
highlights: Cross-compiled LLVM to make a WebAssembly version for libclang, enabling C/C++ source parsing and AST traversal directly in the browser without any servers or dependencies.
Developed FFIgenPad, a web app using SolidJS that generates Dart foreign function bindings from C headers entirely in the browser, without the need for any server-side processing.
Developed Dart AST explorer, a web app that allows you to visualize and explore the Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) of Dart code snippets in real-time.

education.institution: Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani

awards.title: Google Code-In 2019 - Finalist
awards.summary: Contributed to the open-source ecosystem for the Julia Programming Language and other organisations, ending up in the world's top 174 contributors.

projects.name: FFIgenPad
projects.description: A web application that generates Dart FFI bindings from C header files directly in the browser using LibClang and WebAssembly.
highlights: Also built libclang-wasm as a separate module.
No server needed, runs completely in the browser.
Has a mini file-system to manage multiple header files and dependencies.
